translations.text: Those who remember Allah while standing, and sitting, and reclining on their sides, and ponder about the creation of the heavens and the earth; “O our Lord! You have not created this without purpose; Purity is to You, therefore save us from the punishment of fire.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: who remember God, standing and sitting and on their sides, and reflect upon the creation of the heavens and the earth: 'Our Lord, Thou hast not created this for vanity. Glory be to Thee! Guard us against the chastisement of the Fire.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Who remember- Allah Standing and sitting and lying on their sides, and reflect on the creation of the heavens and the earth: our Lord Thou createdest not all this in vain. Hallowed be Thou! Save us, Thou, from the torment of the Fire!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Those who remember Allah (always, and in prayers) standing, sitting, and lying down on their sides, and think deeply about the creation of the heavens and the earth, (saying): "Our Lord! You have not created (all) this without purpose, glory to You! (Exalted be You above all that they associate with You as partners). Give us salvation from the torment of the Fire.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Those who remember God while standing, and sitting, and on their sides; and they reflect upon the creation of the heavens and the earth: “Our Lord, You did not create this in vain, glory to You, so protect us from the punishment of the Fire.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: those who remember Allah while standing, sitting or (reclining) on their backs, and reflect in the creation of the heavens and the earth, (saying): 'Our Lord! You have not created this in vain. Glory to You! Save us, then, from the chastisement of the Fire.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Those who remember Allah standing, sitting, and lying down on their sides, and think deeply about the creation of the heavens and the earth, (saying): "Our Lord! You have not created this without purpose, glory to You! Give us salvation from the torment of the Fire.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Such as remember Allah, standing, sitting, and reclining, and consider the creation of the heavens and the earth, (and say): Our Lord! Thou createdst not this in vain. Glory be to Thee! Preserve us from the doom of Fire.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Those who remember Allah standing, sitting, and lying on their sides, and reflect on the creation of the heavens and the earth [and say], ‘Our Lord, You have not created this in vain! Immaculate are You! Save us from the punishment of the Fire.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Those who remember Allah when standing, sitting, and on their sides, and contemplate upon the creation of the heavens and the earth (saying:) 'Lord, You have not created these in falsehood. Exaltations to You! Guard us against the punishment of the Fire.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Who remember Allah while standing or sitting or [lying] on their sides and give thought to the creation of the heavens and the earth, [saying], "Our Lord, You did not create this aimlessly; exalted are You [above such a thing]; then protect us from the punishment of the Fire.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: It is these who commemorate God while standing, sitting, or resting on their sides and who think about the creation of the heavens and the earth and say, "Lord, you have not created all this without reason. Glory be to you. Lord, save us from the torment of the fire".

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Those who remember Allah standing and sitting and lying on their sides and reflect on the creation of the heavens and the earth: Our Lord! Thou hast not created this in vain! Glory be to Thee; save us then from the chastisement of the fire:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Allatheena yathkuroona Allaha qiyaman waquAAoodan waAAala junoobihim wayatafakkaroona fee khalqi alssamawati waalardi rabbana ma khalaqta hatha batilan subhanaka faqina AAathaba alnnari

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: who remember God while standing, sitting and [lying] on their sides, and who ponder over the creation of the heavens and the earth, saying, "Lord, You have not created all this without purpose. Glory be to You! Save us from the torment of the Fire.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Men who celebrate the praises of Allah, standing, sitting, and lying down on their sides, and contemplate the (wonders of) creation in the heavens and the earth, (With the thought): "Our Lord! not for naught Hast Thou created (all) this! Glory to Thee! Give us salvation from the penalty of the Fire.

verses.text: رَبَّنَا إِنَّکَ‌ مَنْ‌ تُدْخِلِ‌ النَّارَ فَقَدْ أَخْزَيْتَهُ‌ وَ مَا لِلظَّالِمِينَ‌ مِنْ‌ أَنْصَارٍ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پروردگارا! بی تردید هر که را تو در آتش در آوری، قطعاً خوار و رسوایش کرده ای، و برای ستمکاران هیج یاری وجود ندارد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اى پروردگار ما، هر كس را كه به آتش افكنى رسوايش كرده‌اى و ظالمان را هيچ ياورى نيست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پروردگارا! به يقين هر كه را تو به آتش وارد كنى خوارش كرده‌اى، و ستمگران را هيچ ياورى نخواهد بود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پروردگارا، هر كه را تو در آتش درآورى، يقيناً رسوايش كرده‌اى، و براى ستمكاران ياورانى نيست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ای پروردگار ما، هر که را در آتش افکنی او را سخت خوار کرده‌ای، و ستمکاران هیچ یاوری ندارند؛

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پروردگارا! بیگمان تو هر که را (به خاطر اعمال زشتش) به آتش درآری، به راستی خوار و زبونش کرده‌ای. و (اینان بر خود و دیگران ستم کرده‌اند و) ستمکاران را یاوری نیست. [[«أَخْزَیْتَهُ»: خوار و زبونش کرده‌ای.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پروردگارا هرکس را که به دوزخ درآوری، خوار و رسوایش ساخته‌ای و ستمکاران یاورانی ندارند

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پروردگارا! هر که را تو (بخاطر اعمالش،) به آتش افکنی، او را خوار و رسوا ساخته‌ای! و برای افراد ستمگر، هیچ یاوری نیست!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پروردگارا هر که را در آتش بری همانا خوارش کرده‌ای و نیست ستمگران را یارانی‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پروردگارا، هر كه را تو به آتش درآورى براستى خوار و رسوايش كرده‌اى، و ستمكاران را هيچ ياورانى نيست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «پروردگارمان! هر که را تو بی‌چون به آتش در آوری، همواره خوار و بی‌مقدارش کرده‌ای. و برای ستمکاران هیچ یاورانی نیستند.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Whoever, O Lord, should be cast into Hell shall be verily disgraced; and the sinners shall have none to help (or save) them.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “O our Lord! You have indeed given disgrace to whomever You put in the fire (of hell); and the unjust do not have any supporters.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Our Lord, whomsoever Thou admittest into the Fire, Thou wilt have abased; and the evildoers shall have no helpers.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Our Lord verily whomsoever Thou makest to enter into the Fire, him Thou hast surely humiliated and for the wrong-doers there shall be no helpers.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Our Lord! Verily, whom You admit to the Fire, indeed, You have disgraced him, and never will the Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers) find any helpers.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “Our Lord, whomever You commit to the Fire, You have disgraced. The wrongdoers will have no helpers.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Our Lord! Whomever You cause to enter the Fire, him You indeed bring to disgrace, and there will be none to succour the wrong-doers.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Our Lord! Verily, whom You admit to the Fire, indeed, You have disgraced him; and never will the wrongdoers find any helpers.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Our Lord! Whom Thou causest to enter the Fire: him indeed Thou hast confounded. For evil-doers there will be no helpers.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Our Lord, whoever that You make enter the Fire will surely have been disgraced by You, and the wrongdoers will have no helpers.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Our Lord, whomsoever You admit into the Fire, You will have abased, and the harmdoers shall have no helpers.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Our Lord, indeed whoever You admit to the Fire - You have disgraced him, and for the wrongdoers there are no helpers.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Those whom You submit to the fire are certainly disgraced. There is no helper for the unjust.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Our Lord! surely whomsoever Thou makest enter the fire, him Thou hast indeed brought to disgrace, and there shall be no helpers for the unjust:

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Rabbana innaka man tudkhili alnnara faqad akhzaytahu wama lilththalimeena min ansarin

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Lord, those whom You condemn to enter the Fire You have surely brought to disgrace. Wrongdoers will have no supporters.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Our Lord! any whom Thou dost admit to the Fire, Truly Thou coverest with shame, and never will wrong-doers Find any helpers!

verses.text: رَبَّنَا إِنَّنَا سَمِعْنَا مُنَادِياً يُنَادِي‌ لِلْإِيمَانِ‌ أَنْ‌ آمِنُوا بِرَبِّکُمْ‌ فَآمَنَّا رَبَّنَا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَ کَفِّرْ عَنَّا سَيِّئَاتِنَا وَ تَوَفَّنَا مَعَ‌ الْأَبْرَارِ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پروردگارا! بی تردید ما [صدای] ندا دهنده ای را شنیدیم [که مردم را] به ایمان فرا می خواند که به پروردگارتان ایمان آورید. پس ما ایمان آوردیم. پروردگارا! گناهان ما را بیامرز، و بدی هایمان را از ما محو کن، و ما را در زمره نیکوکاران بمیران.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اى پروردگار ما، شنيديم كه مناديى به ايمان فرا مى‌خواند كه به پروردگارتان ايمان بياوريد. و ما ايمان آورديم. پس، اى پروردگار ما، گناهان ما را بيامرز و بديهاى ما را از ما بزداى و ما را با نيكان بميران.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پروردگارا! همانا ما صداى منادى [توحيد] را شنيديم كه به ايمان دعوت مى‌كرد [و مى‌گفت‌] به پروردگارتان ايمان بياوريد، پس ايمان آورديم. بار الها! پس گناهان ما را ببخش و بدى‌هايمان را پوشيده دار و ما را با نيكان بميران

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پروردگارا، ما شنيديم كه دعوتگرى به ايمان فرا مى‌خواند كه: «به پروردگار خود ايمان آوريد»، پس ايمان آورديم. پروردگارا، گناهان ما را بيامرز، و بديهاى ما را بزداى و ما را در زمره نيكان بميران.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پروردگارا، ما صدای منادیی که خلق را به ایمان فرا می‌خواند که به پروردگارتان ایمان آورید، شنیدیم و ایمان آوردیم، پروردگارا، از گناهان ما درگذر و زشتی کردار ما بپوشان و هنگام جان سپردن ما را با نیکان و صالحان محشور گردان؛

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پروردگارا! ما از منادی (بزرگوار توحید، یعنی محمّد پسر عبدالله) شنیدیم که (مردم را) به ایمان به پروردگارشان می‌خواند و ما ایمان آوردیم (و ندای او را لبّیک گفتیم. اکنون که چنین است) پروردگارا! گناهانمان را بیامرز و بدیهایمان را بپوشان و ما را با نیکان و (در مسیر ایشان) بمیران. [[«مُنَادِیاً»: ندادهنده. مراد پیغمبر اسلام یا قرآنی است که به ارمغان آورده است. «ذُنُوب»: گناهان کبیره. «سَیِّئَات»: گناهان صغیره. «أَبْرَار»: جمع بَرّ و بارّ، نیکان. «تَوَفَّنَا مَعَ الأبْرَار»: ما را با نیکان بمیران. مراد این است که هر چند ما نیک نیستیم ولی با این وجود ما را در سلک نیکان قرار و از زمره ایشان قلمداد فرما.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پروردگارا شنیدیم که دعوتگری به ایمان فرامی‌خواند که به پروردگارتان ایمان بیاورید، و ما ایمان آوردیم، پروردگارا گناهان ما را بیامرز و سیئات ما را بزدای و ما را در زمره نیکان بمیران‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پروردگارا! ما صدای منادی (تو) را شنیدیم که به ایمان دعوت می‌کرد که: «به پروردگار خود، ایمان بیاورید!» و ما ایمان آوردیم؛ پروردگارا! گناهان ما را ببخش! و بدیهای ما را بپوشان! و ما را با نیکان (و در مسیر آنها) بمیران!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پروردگارا همانا ما شنیدیم بانگ‌دهنده‌ای را که بانگ می‌داد برای ایمان که ایمان آرید به پروردگار خویش پس ایمان آوردیم پروردگارا بیامرز برای ما گناهان ما را و بزدای از ما زشتیهای ما را و دریاب ما را با نیکان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پروردگارا، ما ندادهنده‌اى را كه به ايمان فراميخواند- يعنى رسول خدا

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «پروردگارمان! ما شنیدیم دعوتگری (ما را) به ایمان فرا می‌خواند که: “به پروردگارتان ایمان آورید.” پس ایمان آوردیم. پروردگارمان! گناهانمان را برایمان بپوشان و بدی‌هامان را جبران فرما و ما را با نیکان بمیران.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: We have heard, O our Lord, the crier call inviting us to faith (and announcing): 'Believe in your Lord.' O our Lord, to faith we have come, so forgive our trespasses, deliver us from sin, and grant us (the glory of) death with the just.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “O our Lord! We have heard a proclaimer calling towards faith, (saying) ‘Believe in your Lord’ so we have accepted faith; Our Lord! Therefore forgive us our sins, and wipe out our evil deeds, and make us die among the virtuous.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Our Lord, we have heard a caller calling us to belief, saying, "Believe you in your Lord!" And we believe. Our Lord, forgive Thou us our sins and acquit us of our evil deeds, and take us to Thee with the pious.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Our Lord verily we heard a caller calling to belief: believe in your Lord, wherefore we have come to believe. Our Lord forgive us our sins, and expiate from us our misdeeds, and let us die along with the pious.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Our Lord! Verily, we have heard the call of one (Muhammad SAW) calling to Faith: 'Believe in your Lord,' and we have believed. Our Lord! Forgive us our sins and remit from us our evil deeds, and make us die in the state of righteousness along with Al-Abrar (those who are obedient to Allah and follow strictly His Orders).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “Our Lord, we have heard a caller calling to the faith: `Believe in your Lord,' and we have believed. Our Lord! Forgive us our sins, and remit our misdeeds, and make us die in the company of the virtuous.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Our Lord! Indeed we heard a crier calling to the faith saying: "Believe in your Lord"; so we did believe. Our Lord, forgive us our sins, and wipe out our evil deeds and make us die with the truly pious.'

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Our Lord! Verily, we have heard the call of one calling to faith: `Believe in your Lord,' and we have believed. Our Lord! Forgive us our sins and expiate from us our evil deeds, and make us die along with Al-Abrar (the most righteous).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Our Lord! Lo! we have heard a crier calling unto Faith: "Believe ye in your Lord!" So we believed. Our Lord! Therefor forgive us our sins, and remit from us our evil deeds, and make us die the death of the righteous.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Our Lord, we have indeed heard a summoner calling to faith, declaring, ‘‘Have faith in your Lord!’’ So we believed. Our Lord, forgive us our sins and absolve us of our misdeeds, and make us die with the pious.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Our Lord, we have heard the caller calling to belief, "Believe in your Lord!" So we believe. Our Lord, forgive us our sins and acquit us of our evil deeds, and take us to You in death with the righteous.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Our Lord, indeed we have heard a caller calling to faith, [saying], 'Believe in your Lord,' and we have believed. Our Lord, so forgive us our sins and remove from us our misdeeds and cause us to die with the righteous.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: "Lord, we have heard the person calling to the faith and have accepted his call. Forgive our sins, expiate our bad deeds, and let us die with the righteous ones.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Our Lord! surely we have heard a preacher calling to the faith, saying: Believe in your Lord, so we did believe; Our Lord! forgive us therefore our faults, and cover our evil deeds and make us die with the righteous.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Rabbana innana samiAAna munadiyan yunadee lileemani an aminoo birabbikum faamanna rabbana faighfir lana thunoobana wakaffir AAanna sayyiatina watawaffana maAAa alabrari

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Lord, we have heard a caller calling to the true faith saying, "Believe in your Lord," and we believed. Lord, forgive us our sins and remove from us our bad deeds and make us die with the virtuous.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Our Lord! we have heard the call of one calling (Us) to Faith, 'Believe ye in the Lord,' and we have believed. Our Lord! Forgive us our sins, blot out from us our iniquities, and take to Thyself our souls in the company of the righteous.

verses.text: رَبَّنَا وَ آتِنَا مَا وَعَدْتَنَا عَلَى‌ رُسُلِکَ‌ وَ لاَ تُخْزِنَا يَوْمَ‌ الْقِيَامَةِ إِنَّکَ‌ لاَ تُخْلِفُ‌ الْمِيعَادَ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پروردگارا! آنچه را که به وسیله فرستادگانت به ما وعده داده ای به ما عطا فرما و روز قیامت، ما را رسوا و خوار مکن؛ زیرا تو خلف وعده نمی کنی؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اى پروردگار ما، عطا كن به ما آنچه را كه به زبان پيامبرانت به ما وعده داده‌اى و ما را در روز قيامت رسوا مكن كه تو وعده خويش خلاف نمى‌كنى.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پروردگارا! و آنچه را بر [زبان‌] پيامبرانت به ما وعده كرده‌اى به ما ارزانى دار، و ما را در روز رستاخيز رسوا مگردان، مسلما تو خلف وعده نمى‌كنى

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پروردگارا، و آنچه را كه به وسيله فرستادگانت به ما وعده داده‌اى به ما عطا كن، و ما را روز رستاخيز رسوا مگردان، زيرا تو وعده‌ات را خلاف نمى‌كنى.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پروردگارا، ما را از آنچه به زبان رسولان خود وعده دادی نصیب فرما و ما را در روز قیامت محروم مگردان، که تو هرگز در وعده تخلّف نمی‌ورزی.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پروردگارا! آنچه را که بر (زبان) پیغمبران خود (و به پاداش تصدیق ایشان و پیروی از آنان) به ما وعده داده‌ای، (از قبیل: پیروزی دنیا و نعمت آخرت) به ما عطاء کن، و در روز رستاخیز ما را (با درآوردن به دوزخ) خوار و زبون مگردان. بیگمان تو خلف وعده نخواهی کرد. [[«عَلَی رُسُلِکَ»: بر زبان پیغمبرانت. مضاف محذوف است و تقدیر چنین است: عَلَی أَلْسِنَةِ رُسُلِکَ. «لا تُخْزِنَا»: خوارمان مدار و زبونمان مگردان. «مِیعَاد»: مصدر میمی است و به معنی وعده. یا به معنی زمان وعده است و مراد رستاخیز است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: پروردگارا آنچه به پیامبرانت وعده داده‌ای به ما ببخش و ما را روز قیامت خوار و رسوا مگردان، که تو خلف وعده نخواهی کرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: پروردگارا! آنچه را به وسیله پیامبرانت به ما وعده فرمودی، به ما عطا کن! و ما را در روز رستاخیز، رسوا مگردان! زیرا تو هیچ‌گاه از وعده خود، تخلف نمی‌کنی.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پروردگارا و ارزانی دار به ما آنچه بر زبان فرستادگانت به ما نوید دادی و خوار مکن ما را روز قیامت که نیستی تو شکننده پیمان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پروردگارا، و آنچه را بر [زبان‌] فرستادگانت به ما وعده دادى به ما ارزانى دار و ما را در روز رستاخيز خوار و رسوا مگردان، كه تو خلاف وعده نمى كنى.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: «پروردگارمان! و آنچه را بر (عهده‌ی) فرستادگانت برایمان وعده داده‌ای به ما بده و ما را روز رستاخیز رسوا مگردان. همانا تو وعده‌(ات) را خلاف نمی‌کنی.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Give us what You promised, O Lord, through Your prophets; and put us not to shame on the Day of Reckoning, for never do You go back on Your promise."

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: “O our Lord! And give us what You have promised us through Your Noble Messengers, and do not humiliate us on the Day of Resurrection; indeed You do not break the promise.”

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Our Lord, give us what Thou hast promised us by Thy Messengers, and abase us not on the Day of Resurrection; Thou wilt not fail the tryst.'

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Our Lord! vouchsafe unto us that which Thou hast promised us by Thine apostles, and humiliate us not on the Day of Resurrection. Verily Thou failest not the tryst.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: "Our Lord! Grant us what You promised unto us through Your Messengers and disgrace us not on the Day of Resurrection, for You never break (Your) Promise."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: “Our Lord, and give us what You have promised us through Your messengers, and do not disgrace us on the Day of Resurrection. Surely You never break a promise.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: 'Our Lord, fulfil what You promised to us through Your Messengers, and disgrace us not on the Day of Resurrection; indeed You never go back on Your promise.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: "Our Lord! Grant us what You promised us through Your Messengers and disgrace us not on the Day of Resurrection, for You never break (Your) Promise."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Our Lord! And give us that which Thou hast promised to us by Thy messengers. Confound us not upon the Day of Resurrection. Lo! Thou breakest not the tryst.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Our Lord, give us what You have promised us through Your apostles, and do not disgrace us on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed You do not break Your promise.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Our Lord, give us what You promised us by Your Messengers, and do not abase us on the Day of Resurrection. You do not break Your promise'

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Our Lord, and grant us what You promised us through Your messengers and do not disgrace us on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed, You do not fail in [Your] promise."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Lord, grant us the victory that You have promised your Messenger and do not disgrace us on the Day of Judgment; You are the One who never ignores His promise."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Our Lord! and grant us what Thou hast promised us by Thy apostles; and disgrace us not on the day of resurrection; surely Thou dost not fail to perform the promise.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Rabbana waatina ma waAAadtana AAala rusulika wala tukhzina yawma alqiyamati innaka la tukhlifu almeeAAada

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Our Lord! Grant us what You have promised to us through Your messengers, and do not humiliate us on the Day of Resurrection. Surely, You never fail to fulfill Your promise."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: "Our Lord! Grant us what Thou didst promise unto us through Thine messengers, and save us from shame on the Day of Judgment: For Thou never breakest Thy promise."

verses.text: فَاسْتَجَابَ‌ لَهُمْ‌ رَبُّهُمْ‌ أَنِّي‌ لاَ أُضِيعُ‌ عَمَلَ‌ عَامِلٍ‌ مِنْکُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ ذَکَرٍ أَوْ أُنْثَى‌ بَعْضُکُمْ‌ مِنْ‌ بَعْضٍ‌ فَالَّذِينَ‌ هَاجَرُوا وَ أُخْرِجُوا مِنْ‌ دِيَارِهِمْ‌ وَ أُوذُوا فِي‌ سَبِيلِي‌ وَ قَاتَلُوا وَ قُتِلُوا لَأُکَفِّرَنَ‌ عَنْهُمْ‌ سَيِّئَاتِهِمْ‌ وَ لَأُدْخِلَنَّهُمْ‌ جَنَّاتٍ‌ تَجْرِي‌ مِنْ‌ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ ثَوَاباً مِنْ‌ عِنْدِ اللَّهِ‌ وَ اللَّهُ‌ عِنْدَهُ‌ حُسْنُ‌ الثَّوَابِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: پس پروردگارشان دعای آنان را اجابت کرد [که] یقیناً من عمل هیچ عمل کننده ای از شما را از مرد یا زن که همه از یکدیگرند تباه نمی کنم؛ پس کسانی که [برای خدا] هجرت کردند، و از خانه هایشان رانده شدند، و در راه من آزار دیدند، و جنگیدند و کشته شدند، قطعاً بدی هایشان را محو خواهم کرد و آنان را به بهشت هایی که از زیرِ [درختانِ] آن نهرها جاری است، وارد می کنم [که] پاداشی است از سوی خدا و خداست که پاداش نیکو نزد اوست.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: پروردگارشان دعايشان را اجابت فرمود كه: من كار هيچ كارگزارى را از شما، چه زن و چه مرد -همه از يكديگريد- ناچيز نمى‌سازم. پس گناهان كسانى را كه مهاجرت كرده‌اند و از خانه‌هايشان رانده شده‌اند و در راه من آزار ديده‌اند و جنگيده‌اند و كشته شده‌اند، مى‌زدايم و آنان را در بهشتهايى كه در آن نهرها جارى است داخل مى‌كنم. اين پاداشى است از جانب خدا و پاداش نيكو نزد خداست.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس پروردگارشان [دعاى ايشان را] اجابت كرد كه من عمل هيچ عاملى از شما را، اعم از مرد يا زن تباه نمى‌كنم. شما همگى از يكديگريد. بنابر اين كسانى كه مهاجرت كردند و از خانه‌هاى خود بيرون رانده شدند و در راه من آزار ديدند و جنگيدند و كشته شدند، بى‌ترديد گن

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: پس، پروردگارشان دعاى آنان را اجابت كرد [و فرمود كه:] من عمل هيچ صاحب عملى از شما را، از مرد يا زن، كه همه از يكديگريد، تباه نمى‌كنم؛ پس، كسانى كه هجرت كرده و از خانه‌هاى خود رانده شده و در راه من آزار ديده و جنگيده و كشته شده‌اند، بديهايشان را از آنان مى‌زدايم، و آنان را در باغهايى كه از زيرِ [درختان‌] آن نهرها روان است درمى‌آورم؛ [اين‌] پاداشى است از جانب خدا و پاداش نيكو نزد خداست.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس خدا دعاهای ایشان را اجابت کرد که البته من (که پروردگارم) عمل هیچ کس از مرد و زن را بی‌مزد نگذارم، زیرا شما از یکدیگرید (و همه در نظر من یکسانید)، پس آنان که از وطن خود هجرت نمودند و از دیار خویش بیرون رانده شدند و در راه من رنج کشیدند و جهاد کرده و کشته شدند همانا بدیهای آنان را بپوشانم و آنها را به بهشتهایی درآورم که زیر درختانش نهرها جاری است. این پاداشی است از جانب خدا، و نزد خدا است پاداش نیکو.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: پس پروردگارشان دعای ایشان را پذیرفت و پاسخشان داد که من عمل هیچ کسی از شما را که به کار پرداخته باشد - خواه مرد باشد یا زن - ضائع نخواهم کرد. پاره‌ای از شما از پاره‌ی دیگر هستید (و همگی همنوع و همجنس می‌باشید). آنان که هجرت کردند، و از خانه‌های خود رانده شدند، و در راه من اذیّت و آزارشان رساندند، و جنگیدند و کشته شدند، هر آینه گناهانشان را می‌بخشم و به بهشتشان درمی‌آورم. بهشتی که رودخانه‌ها در زیر (درختان) آن روان است. این پاداشی از سوی خدا، (ایشان را) است، و پاداش نیکو تنها نزد خدا است. [[«إِسْتَجَابَ»: پذیرفت. پاسخ داد. «أَنِّی»: که من. فتحه همزه با توجّه به حرف جرّ محذوفی است که تقدیر چنین است: فَاسْتَجَابَ لَهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ بِأَنِّی لآ أُضِیعُ. «بَعْضُکُم مِّن بَعْضٍ»: برخی از برخی دیگرید. مراد این که مرد و زن از یک جنس بوده و برتری آنان با عمل صالح است. «لاُکَفِّرَنَّ»: بیگمان محو می‌گردانم و می‌زدایم. «ثَوَاباً»: مفعول مطلق فعل محذوف (لأُثِیبَنَّهُمْ) است یا تمییز و یا حال (جَنَّات) و ... «حُسْنُ الثَّوَابِ»: پاداش نیکو. اضافه صفت به موصوف است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آنگاه پروردگارشان دعای آنان را اجابت کرد که من عمل هیچ صاحب عملی را از شما چه مرد باشد، چه زن -که همه همانند یکدیگریدضایع [و بی‌پاداش‌] نمی‌گذارم، آری کسانی که هجرت کرده‌اند و از خانه و کاشانه‌هایشان رانده شده‌اند و در راه من آزار دیده‌اند و به جهاد پرداخته‌اند و کشته شده‌اند، سیئاتشان را می‌زدایم و به بوستانهایی که جویباران از فرو دست آن جاری است درشان می‌آورم، این پاداش الهی است و پاداش نیکو نزد خداوند است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: خداوند، درخواست آنها را پذیرفت؛ (و فرمود:) من عمل هیچ عمل‌کننده‌ای از شما را، زن باشد یا مرد، ضایع نخواهم کرد؛ شما همنوعید، و از جنس یکدیگر! آنها که در راه خدا هجرت کردند، و از خانه‌های خود بیرون رانده شدند و در راه من آزار دیدند، و جنگ کردند و کشته شدند، بیقین گناهانشان را می‌بخشم؛ و آنها را در باغهای بهشتی، که از زیر درختانش نهرها جاری است، وارد می‌کنم. این پاداشی است از طرف خداوند؛ و بهترین پاداشها نزد پروردگار است.

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس پذیرفت از ایشان پروردگارشان که تباه ننمایم کار هر عمل‌کننده‌ای را از شما مرد یا آن بعضیتان از بعضی پس آنان که هجرت کردند و برون (رانده شدند) از خانه‌های خویش و آزار شدند در راه من و جنگ کردند و کشته شدند همانا بزُدایم از ایشان زشتیهای ایشان را و درآرمشان باغهائی که روان است از زیر آنها جویها پاداشی از نزد خدا و خدا نزد او است پاداش نیکو

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس پروردگارشان آنان را پاسخ داد كه من كار هيچ عمل‌كننده‌اى از شما را، از مرد يا زن، تباه نكنم برخى تان از برخى ديگريد. پس كسانى كه هجرت نمودند و [آنان كه‌] از خانه‌هاى خويش بيرون رانده شدند و [آنان كه‌] در راه من آزار ديدند و [آنان كه‌] كارزار كردند و [آنان كه‌] كشته شدند هر آينه گناهانشان را از ايشان بزدايم و آنان را به بهشت‌هايى در آورم كه از زير [درختان‌] آنها جويها روان است تا پاداشى باشد از نزد خدا، و خداست كه پاداش نيكو نزد اوست.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس پروردگارشان (دعای آنان را) برایشان اجابت کرد (و فرمود): «من همواره عمل هیچ صاحب عملی از شما را، از مرد یا زنی - حال آنکه برخی از برخی دیگرید- تباه نمی‌کنم. پس کسانی که هجرت کرده و از خانه‌های خود رانده شده و در راه من آزار دیده و جنگیده و کشته شده‌اند، بی‌گمان گناهانشان را به‌راستی از ایشان می‌زدایم و آنان را همواره در باغ‌هایی که از زیر (درختان)‌شان نهرها روان است، به‌درستی، در می‌آورم. حال آنکه (این) پاداشی است از جانب خدا، و پاداش نیکو تنها نزد خداست.»

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: The Lord heard their prayer and answered: "I suffer not the good deeds of any to go waste, be he a man or a woman: The one of you is of the other. And those who were deprived of their homes or banished in My cause, and who fought and were killed, I shall blot out their sins and admit them indeed into gardens with rippling streams." -- A recompense from God, and the best of rewards is with God.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So their Lord accepted their prayer, for I do not waste the efforts of any (righteous) worker, male or female; you are all one among yourselves; so those who migrated and were driven out from their homes and were harassed in My cause, and fought, and were slain – I will certainly wipe out all their sins and will certainly admit them into Gardens beneath which rivers flow; a reward from Allah; and only with Allah is the best reward.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And their Lord answers them: 'I waste not the labour of any that labours among you, be you male or female -- the one of you is as the other. And those who emigrated, and were expelled from their habitations, those who suffered hurt in My way, and fought, and were slain -- them I shall surely acquit of their evil deeds, and I shall admit them to gardens underneath which rivers flow.' A reward from God! And God with Him is the fairest reward.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then their Lord hearkened unto them saying: I let not the work of a worker amongst you to waste, man or woman, one of you from the other. So those who emigrated and were driven forth from their homes and persecuted in My cause, and who fought and were slain, surely I shall expiate from them their misdeeds and surely I shall make them enter Gardens whereunder rivers flow; a reward from before Allah! And Allah! with Him is the excellent reward.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So their Lord accepted of them (their supplication and answered them), "Never will I allow to be lost the work of any of you, be he male or female. You are (members) one of another, so those who emigrated and were driven out from their homes, and suffered harm in My Cause, and who fought, and were killed (in My Cause), verily, I will remit from them their evil deeds and admit them into Gardens under which rivers flow (in Paradise); a reward from Allah, and with Allah is the best of rewards."

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And so their Lord answered them: “I will not waste the work of any worker among you, whether male or female. You are one of another. For those who emigrated, and were expelled from their homes, and were persecuted because of Me, and fought and were killed—I will remit for them their sins, and will admit them into gardens beneath which rivers flow—a reward from God. With God is the ultimate reward.”

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Their Lord answered the Prayer thus: "I will not suffer the work of any of you, whether male or female, to go to waste; each of you is from the other. Those who emigrated and were driven out from their homesteads and were persecuted in My cause, and who fought and were slain, indeed I shall wipe out their evil deeds from them and shall certainly admit them to the gardens beneath which rivers flow." This is their reward with their Lord; and with Allah lies the best reward.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So their Lord accepted of them (their supplication and answered them), "Never will I allow to be lost the work of any of you, be he male or female. You are (members) one of another, so those who emigrated and were driven out from their homes, and suffered harm in My cause, and who fought and were killed (in My cause), verily, I will expiate from them their evil deeds and admit them into Gardens under which rivers flow (in Paradise); a reward from Allah, and with Allah is the best of rewards."

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And their Lord hath heard them (and He saith): Lo! I suffer not the work of any worker, male or female, to be lost. Ye proceed one from another. So those who fled and were driven forth from their homes and suffered damage for My cause, and fought and were slain, verily I shall remit their evil deeds from them and verily I shall bring them into Gardens underneath which rivers flow - A reward from Allah. And with Allah is the fairest of rewards.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Then their Lord answered them, ‘I do not waste the work of any worker among you, whether male or female; you are all on the same footing. So those who migrated and were expelled from their homes, and were tormented in My way, and those who fought and were killed—I will surely absolve them of their misdeeds and I will admit them into gardens with streams running in them, as a reward from Allah, and Allah—with Him is the best of rewards.’

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: And indeed their Lord answers them: 'I do not waste the labor of any that labors among you, male or female you are from each other. And those who emigrated, and were expelled from their houses, those who suffered hurt in My way, and fought, and were killed those I shall surely acquit of their evil deeds, and I shall admit them to Gardens underneath which rivers flow' A reward from Allah, and Allah with Him is the best reward.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And their Lord responded to them, "Never will I allow to be lost the work of [any] worker among you, whether male or female; you are of one another. So those who emigrated or were evicted from their homes or were harmed in My cause or fought or were killed - I will surely remove from them their misdeeds, and I will surely admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow as reward from Allah, and Allah has with Him the best reward."

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Their Lord answered their prayers saying, "I do not neglect anyone's labor whether the laborer be male or female. You are all related to one another. Those who migrated from Mecca, those who were expelled from their homes, those who were tortured for My cause, and those who fought and were killed for My cause will find their sins expiated by Me and I will admit them into the gardens wherein streams flow. It will be their reward from God Who grants the best rewards."

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So their Lord accepted their prayer: That I will not waste the work of a worker among you, whether male or female, the one of you being from the other; they, therefore, who fled and were turned out of their homes and persecuted in My way and who fought and were slain, I will most certainly cover their evil deeds, and I will most certainly make them enter gardens beneath which rivers flow; a reward from Allah, and with Allah is yet better reward.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Faistajaba lahum rabbuhum annee la odeeAAu AAamala AAamilin minkum min thakarin aw ontha baAAdukum min baAAdin faallatheena hajaroo waokhrijoo min diyarihim waoothoo fee sabeelee waqataloo waqutiloo laokaffiranna AAanhum sayyiatihim walaodkhilannahum jannatin tajree min tahtiha alanharu thawaban min AAindi Allahi waAllahu AAindahu husnu alththawabi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Their Lord accepted their prayer, saying, "I will deny no man or woman among you the reward of their labours. You are members one of another. I will certainly forgive the sins of those who emigrated and were expelled from their homes, who suffered persecution in My cause, who fought and were killed. I will certainly admit them to Gardens through which rivers flow, as a reward from God: with God is the best reward."

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And their Lord hath accepted of them, and answered them: "Never will I suffer to be lost the work of any of you, be he male or female: Ye are members, one of another: Those who have left their homes, or been driven out therefrom, or suffered harm in My Cause, or fought or been slain,- verily, I will blot out from them their iniquities, and admit them into Gardens with rivers flowing beneath;- A reward from the presence of Allah, and from His presence is the best of rewards."

verses.text: لاَ يَغُرَّنَّکَ‌ تَقَلُّبُ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ کَفَرُوا فِي‌ الْبِلاَدِ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: رفت و آمد کافران در شهرها [با وسایل و ابزار فراوان و شوکت ظاهری] تو را به طمع نیندازد.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: جولان كافران در شهرها تو را نفريبد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: گشت و گذار كافران در شهرها تو را نفريبد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: مبادا رفت و آمد [و جنب و جوش‌] كافران در شهرها تو را دستخوش فريب كند.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (دنیا) تو را نفریبد چون بینی که کافران در شهرها به راحتی می‌گردند.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: رفت و آمد (پیروزمندانه، و اشتغال به کسب و کار و تجارت و بسر بردن در ناز و نعمت) کافران در شهرها، تو را نفریبد. [[«لا یَغُرَّنَّکَ»: تو را گول نزند. «تَقَلُّبُ»: گشت و گذار. آمد و شد (نگا: نحل / 46). غلْط خوردن در ثروت و نعمت. «بِلاد»: جمع بلد، شهرها. جاها و سرزمینها.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: گشت و گذار کافران در شهرها تو را نفریبد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: رفت و آمد (پیروزمندانه) کافران در شهرها، تو را نفریبد!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: فریفته‌ات نکند گردش آنان که کفر ورزیدند در شهرها

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: رفت و آمد- سودجويى و كاميابى- كافران در شهرها تو را نفريبد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: هرگز مباد (که) رفت و آمد با جنب‌و‌جوش کافران در شهرها تو را فریب دهد.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Be not deceived by the comings and goings of unbelievers in the land.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: O listener (followers of this Prophet)! Do not ever be deceived by the disbelievers’ free movements in the cities.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Let it not delude thee, that the unbelievers go to and fro in the land;

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Let not beguile thee the moving to and fro about of those who disbelieve, in the cities

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Let not the free disposal (and affluence) of the disbelievers throughout the land deceive you.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Do not be impressed by the disbelievers’ movements in the land.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: (O Messenger!) Do not let the strutting about of the unbelievers in the land deceive you.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Let not the free disposal (and affluence) of the disbelievers throughout the land deceive you.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Let not the vicissitude (of the success) of those who disbelieve, in the land, deceive thee (O Muhammad).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Never be misled by the bustle of the faithless in the towns.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Do not let the coming and going in the land of those who disbelieve delude you;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Be not deceived by the [uninhibited] movement of the disbelievers throughout the land.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: (Muhammad), do not be deceived by the changing activities of the unbelievers in different parts of the land.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Let it not deceive you that those who disbelieve go to and fro in the cities fearlessly.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: La yaghurrannaka taqallubu allatheena kafaroo fee albiladi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Do not be deceived by the actions of those who deny the truth in the land:

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Let not the strutting about of the Unbelievers through the land deceive thee:

verses.text: مَتَاعٌ‌ قَلِيلٌ‌ ثُمَ‌ مَأْوَاهُمْ‌ جَهَنَّمُ‌ وَ بِئْسَ‌ الْمِهَادُ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [این] برخورداری اندک [و ناچیزی از زندگی زود گذر دنیا] است؛ سپس جایگاهشان دوزخ است، و آن بد آرامگاهی است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اين برخوردارى اندكى است. پس از آن جايگاهشان جهنم است و جهنم بد آرامگاهى است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اين بهره‌ى ناچيزى است و سپس جايگاهشان جهنّم است كه بد جايگاهى است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: [اين‌] كالاى ناچيز [و برخوردارىِ اندكى‌] است؛ سپس جايگاهشان دوزخ است، و چه بد قرارگاهى است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: این متاعی اندک است و پس از این جهان منزلگاه آنان جهنم است و بد آرامگاهی است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: (این) متاع ناچیزی است، سپس (به دنبال این نعمت و قدرت ناچیز ظاهری) جایگاهشان دوزخ است، و چه بد جایگاهی است! [[«مَتَاعٌ»: کالا و نعمت. تمتّع و بهره‌مندی. خبر مبتدای محذوفی چون (هُوَ) است که مرجع آن (تَقَلُّب) است. «مَأْوَی»: مکانی که سرانجام بدان پناه می‌برند (نگا: آل‌عمران / 151). «مِهَاد»: آرامگاه. بِستر.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بهره‌مندی ناچیزی است، سپس سرا و سرانجام آنان جهنم است و چه بد آرامگاهی است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: این متاع ناچیزی است؛ و سپس جایگاهشان دوزخ، و چه بد جایگاهی است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: بهره‌ای است اندک و سپس جایگاه ایشان دوزخ است و چه زشت آرامشگاهی است‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: [اين‌] برخوردارى اندك است سپس جايگاهشان دوزخ است و بد آرامگاهى است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (این) کالایی ناچیز (و برخورداری اندکی) است. سپس پناهگاهشان دوزخ است و چه بد آرامگاهی است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Their commerce is but short-lived, and then their abode shall be Hell: And what an evil abode!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: It is a brief usage; their home is hell; and what an evil resting-place!

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: a little enjoyment, then their refuge is Gehenna -- an evil cradling!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: A brief enjoyment, and then Hell shall be their abode; ill is the resort!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: A brief enjoyment; then, their ultimate abode is Hell; and worst indeed is that place for rest.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: A brief enjoyment, then their abode is Hell. What a miserable resort.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: This is but a little enjoyment, then their destination is Hell -what an evil resting place!

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: A brief enjoyment; then their ultimate abode is Hell; and worst indeed is that place for rest.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: It is but a brief comfort. And afterward their habitation will be hell, an ill abode.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: It is a trivial enjoyment; then their refuge is hell, and it is an evil resting place.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: a little enjoyment, then, their shelter is in Gehenna (Hell), an evil cradling.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: [It is but] a small enjoyment; then their [final] refuge is Hell, and wretched is the resting place.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Their gains are only a means of enjoyment in this life. However, their destination is hell, the terrible dwelling.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: A brief enjoyment! then their abode is hell, and evil is the resting-place.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: MataAAun qaleelun thumma mawahum jahannamu wabisa almihadu

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: this is only a brief enjoyment, after which Hell shall be their abode -- what an evil resting place!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Little is it for enjoyment: Their ultimate abode is Hell: what an evil bed (To lie on)!

verses.text: لٰکِنِ‌ الَّذِينَ‌ اتَّقَوْا رَبَّهُمْ‌ لَهُمْ‌ جَنَّاتٌ‌ تَجْرِي‌ مِنْ‌ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ‌ فِيهَا نُزُلاً مِنْ‌ عِنْدِ اللَّهِ‌ وَ مَا عِنْدَ اللَّهِ‌ خَيْرٌ لِلْأَبْرَارِ

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: کسانی که از پروردگارشان پروا کردند [و فریفته زرق و برق زندگی مادی نشدند] برای آنان بهشت هایی است که از زیرِ [درختانِ] آن نهرها جاری است، در آنجا جاودانه اند. [این به عنوان آغاز] پذیرایی از سوی خداست، و آنچه [غیر از بهشت و نعمت هایش] نزد خداست، برای نیکوکاران بهتر است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اما براى آنان كه از پروردگارشان مى‌ترسند، بهشتهايى است كه در آن نهرها جارى است. همواره در آنجا مهمان خدا هستند. و آنچه نزد خداست براى نيكان بهتر است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: ولى آنان كه تقواى الهى پيش گرفتند برايشان باغ‌هايى است كه از پاى درختانش نهرها جارى است و جاودانه در آن مى‌مانند، كه [اين‌] پذيرايى از جانب خداست و آنچه نزد خداست براى نيكان بهتر است

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: ولى كسانى كه پرواى پروردگارشان را پيشه ساخته‌اند باغهايى خواهند داشت كه از زير [درختان‌] آن نهرها روان است. در آنجا جاودانه بمانند؛ [اين‌] پذيرايى از جانب خداست، و آنچه نزد خداست براى نيكان بهتر است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: لیکن آنان که خداترس و با تقوایند منزلگاهشان بهشت‌هایی است که در زیر درختانش نهرها جاری است و در آن جاودانند، در حالتی که خدا بر آنها خوان احسان خود گسترده، و آنچه نزد خداست برای نیکان بهتر است.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ولی آنان که از (خشم) پروردگارشان (با انجام طاعات و ترک منهیّات) می‌پرهیزند، بهشت از آن ایشان است که در زیر (درختان) آن رودخانه‌ها روان است، و جاودانه در آن می‌مانند. (تازه، این لذائذ جسمانی) به عنوان مهمانی و پذیرائی (نخستین) از جانب خدا است، و آنچه (از لذائذ روحانی و الطاف بیکران صمدانی) در پیشگاه یزدان است برای نیکان (بسی والاتر از آن، و) بهتر (از متاع فانی جهان) است. [[«نُزُلاً»: نوشیدنی و خوراکی که از مهمان در آغاز نزول، بدان پذیرائی می‌کنند. زاد و توشه. حال (جَنَّات) است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: اما کسانی که از پروردگارشان پروا داشته‌اند، بوستانهایی دارند که جویباران از فرودست آن جاری است و جاودانه در آنند، این پیشکش الهی است و آنچه در نزد خداوند است برای نیکوکاران بهتر است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ولی کسانی (که ایمان دارند، و) از پروردگارشان می‌پرهیزند، برای آنها باغهایی از بهشت است، که از زیر درختانش نهرها جاری است؛ همیشه در آن خواهند بود. این، نخستین پذیرایی است که از سوی خداوند به آنها می‌رسد؛ و آنچه در نزد خداست، برای نیکان بهتر است!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: لیکن آنان که پروردگار خود را ترسیدند برای ایشان است باغهائی که جاری است از زیر آنها جویها جاودانان در آنها پیشکشی از نزد خدا و آنچه نزد خدا است بهتر است برای نیکان‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اما كسانى كه ترس از پروردگار خويش را پيشه كردند ايشان را بهشت‌هايى است كه از زير آنها جويها روان است، در آنجا جاودانه باشند، تا پذيرائيى باشد از نزد خدا و آنچه نزد خداست نيكوكاران را بهتر است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: ولی کسانی که از پروردگارشان پروا دارند، برایشان باغ‌هایی است که از زیر (درختان)شان نهرها روان است، (که) در آن جاودانه‌اند. حال آنکه (این) مهمان‌سرایی از جانب خداست و آنچه نزد خداست برای نیکان بهتر است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But those who are pious and obedient to their Lord, will have gardens with streams of running water where they will abide as guests of God; and what is with God is best for the pious.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: But for those who fear their Lord are Gardens beneath which rivers flow – abiding in it for ever – the hospitality from their Lord; and that which is with Allah, is the best for the righteous.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: But those who fear their Lord - for them shall be gardens underneath which rivers flow, therein dwelling forever -- a hospitality God Himself offers; and that which is with God is better for the pious.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: But as to those who fear their Lord, theirs shall be Gardens whereunder rivers flow; they shall be abiders therein: an entertainment from before their Lord; and that which is with Allah it still better for the pious.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But, for those who fear their Lord, are Gardens under which rivers flow (in Paradise); therein are they to dwell (for ever), an entertainment from Allah; and that which is with Allah is the Best for Al-Abrar (those who are obedient to Allah and follow strictly His Orders).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: As for those who feared their Lord: for them will be gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever—hospitality from God. What God possesses is best for the just.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But those who fear their Lord: theirs shall be the gardens beneath which rivers flow and in which they will live forever: a hospitality from Allah Himself, And Allah's reward is best for the truly pious.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But, for those who have Taqwa of their Lord, are Gardens under which rivers flow (in Paradise); therein are they to dwell, an entertainment from Allah; and that which is with Allah is the best for Al-Abrar (the most righteous).

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But those who keep their duty to their Lord, for them are Gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will be safe for ever. A gift of welcome from their Lord. That which Allah hath in store is better for the righteous.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: But those who are wary of their Lord—for them shall be gardens with streams running in them, to remain in them [forever], a hospitality from Allah; and what is with Allah is better for the pious.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: But for those who fear their Lord, for them shall be Gardens underneath which rivers flow, there they shall live for ever, a (goodly) hosting from Allah, and that which is with Allah is better for the righteous.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But those who feared their Lord will have gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding eternally therein, as accommodation from Allah. And that which is with Allah is best for the righteous.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: For those who have fear of their Lord, there will be gardens wherein streams flow and they will live therein forever as a gift from their Lord. God has the best reward for the virtuous people.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But as to those who are careful of (their duty to) their Lord, they shall have gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding in them; an entertainment from their Lord, and that which is with Allah is best for the righteous.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Lakini allatheena ittaqaw rabbahum lahum jannatun tajree min tahtiha alanharu khalideena feeha nuzulan min AAindi Allahi wama AAinda Allahi khayrun lilabrari

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Those who fear their Lord shall have gardens through which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever: and a goodly welcome from their Lord. God's recompense is best for the virtuous.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: On the other hand, for those who fear their Lord, are Gardens, with rivers flowing beneath; therein are they to dwell (for ever),- a gift from the presence of Allah; and that which is in the presence of Allah is the best (bliss) for the righteous.

verses.text: وَ إِنَ‌ مِنْ‌ أَهْلِ‌ الْکِتَابِ‌ لَمَنْ‌ يُؤْمِنُ‌ بِاللَّهِ‌ وَ مَا أُنْزِلَ‌ إِلَيْکُمْ‌ وَ مَا أُنْزِلَ‌ إِلَيْهِمْ‌ خَاشِعِينَ‌ لِلَّهِ‌ لاَ يَشْتَرُونَ‌ بِآيَاتِ‌ اللَّهِ‌ ثَمَناً قَلِيلاً أُولٰئِکَ‌ لَهُمْ‌ أَجْرُهُمْ‌ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِمْ‌ إِنَ‌ اللَّهَ‌ سَرِيعُ‌ الْحِسَابِ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بی تردید از اهل کتاب کسانی هستند که به خدا و آنچه به سوی شما نازل شده و آنچه به سوی خودشان فرود آمده ایمان می آورند، در حالی که در برابر خدا فروتن و خاکسار بوده، آیات خدا را به بهای اندک نمی فروشند. برای آنان نزد پروردگارشان پاداشی شایسته و مناسب است؛ یقیناً خدا حسابرسی سریع است.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: بعضى از اهل كتاب به خدا و كتابى كه بر شما نازل شده و كتابى كه بر خودشان نازل شده است ايمان دارند. مطيع فرمان خدايند. آيات خدا را به بهاى اندك نمى‌فروشند. مزد ايشان نزد پروردگارشان است. هر آينه خدا حسابها را زود خواهد رسيد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: و البته از ميان اهل كتاب كسانى هستند كه خاشعانه در برابر خدا به آنچه بر شما نازل شده و آنچه بر خودشان نازل گرديده ايمان مى‌آورند و آيات خدا را به بهاى ناچيز نمى‌فروشند. اينانند كه پاداششان نزد پروردگارشان [برايشان محفوظ] است و مسلما خدا حسابرس سريع

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و البته از ميان اهل كتاب كسانى هستند كه به خدا و بدانچه به سوى شما نازل شده و به آنچه به سوى خودشان فرود آمده ايمان دارند، در حالى كه در برابر خدا خاشعند، و آيات خدا را به بهاى ناچيزى نمى‌فروشند. اينانند كه نزد پروردگارشان پاداش خود را خواهند داشت. آرى! خدا زودشمار است.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: همانا برخی از اهل کتاب کسانی‌اند که به خدا و کتاب آسمانی شما و کتاب آسمانی خودشان ایمان آورند در حالی که مطیع فرمان خدا بوده و آیات خدا را به بهای اندک نفروشند، آن طایفه را نزد خدا پاداش نیکوست، و البته خدا حساب خلق را سریع و آسان خواهد رسید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: برخی از اهل کتاب هستند که به خدا و بدانچه بر شما نازل شده و بدانچه بر خود آنان نازل گردیده است، ایمان دارند. در برابر خدا فروتن بوده و آیات خدا را به بهای ناچیز (دنیا) نمی‌فروشند. پاداش ایشان در نزد پروردگارشان (محفوظ) است. بیگمان خداوند سریع‌الحساب است (و به سرعت تمام در مدّتی اندک به حساب اعمال همگان رسیدگی کرده و پاداش و پادافره نیکان و بدان را بدون کم و کاست خواهد داد). [[«خَاشِعِینَ»: فروتنان. حال است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و از اهل کتاب کسانی هستند که به خداوند و آنچه برای شما نازل شده و آنچه برای خودشان نازل شده، ایمان دارند، و در برابر خداوند خاشعند و آیات الهی را به بهای ناچیز نمی‌فروشند، پاداش اینان نزد پروردگارشان [محفوظ] است که خداوند زودشمار است‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و از اهل کتاب، کسانی هستند که به خدا، و آنچه بر شما نازل شده، و آنچه بر خودشان نازل گردیده، ایمان دارند؛ در برابر (فرمان) خدا خاضعند؛ و آیات خدا را به بهای ناچیزی نمی‌فروشند. پاداش آنها، نزد پروردگارشان است. خداوند، سریع الحساب است. (تمام اعمال نیک آنها را به سرعت حساب می‌کند، و پاداش می‌دهد.)

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: همانا از اهل کتاب است آنکه ایمان آورد به خدا و آنچه فرود آورده شد بر شما و آنچه فرود آورده شد بر ایشان فروتنی‌کنان برای خدا نفروشند آیتهای خدا را به بهائی کم آنان را است پاداش ایشان نزد پروردگارشان همانا خدا است شتابنده در حساب‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و هر آينه از اهل كتاب كسانى هستند كه به خدا و آنچه به شما و آنان فروفرستاده شده مى‌گروند، در حالى كه خدا را فروتن و گردن نهاده‌اند در برابر آيات خدا بهايى اندك نمى‌ستانند، اينان مزدشان نزد پروردگارشان است. همانا خدا زود حساب است.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: و بی‌گمان از میان اهل کتاب کسانی هستند که به خدا - و بدانچه سوی شما نازل شده و به آنچه سوی خودشان فرود آمده - ایمان می‌آورند، در حالی که برای خدا خاشعند، و با آیات خدا (چیزی را به) بهایی ناچیز نمی‌خرند. ایشانند که نزد پروردگارشان پاداش خود را خواهند داشت. همواره، خدا زودشمار است.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Certainly among the people of the Book are some who believe in God and in what has been revealed to you and had been revealed to them; and they bow in humility before God, and do not trade for paltry gain the signs of God. Their reward is verily with their Lord; and swift is the reckoning of God!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: And undoubtedly there are some among the People given the Book(s), who accept faith in Allah and what is sent down to you and what was sent down to them – their hearts are submitted humbly before Allah – they do not exchange the verses of Allah for an abject price; they are those whose reward is with their Lord; indeed Allah is Swift At Taking Account.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: And some there are of the People of the Book who believe in God, and what has been sent down unto you, and what has been sent down unto them, men humble to God, not selling the signs of God for a small price; those -- their wage is with their Lord; God is swift at the reckoning.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And verily of the people of the Book there are some who believe in Allah and in that which hath been sent down unto you and that which hath been sent down unto them, humbling themselves before Allah, and barter not the revelations of Allah for a small price, these they shall have their hire with Allah. Verily Allah swift in reckoning.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And there are, certainly, among the people of the Scripture (Jews and Christians), those who believe in Allah and in that which has been revealed to you, and in that which has been revealed to them, humbling themselves before Allah. They do not sell the Verses of Allah for a little price, for them is a reward with their Lord. Surely, Allah is Swift in account.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Among the People of the Scripture are those who believe in God, and in what was revealed to you, and in what was revealed to them. They are humble before God, and they do not sell God’s revelations for a cheap price. These will have their reward with their Lord. God is swift in reckoning.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: And among the People of the Book some believe in Allah and what has been revealed to you, and what has been revealed to them. They humble themselves before Allah, and do not sell Allah's revelations for a small price. For these men their reward is with their Lord. Allah is swift in His reckoning.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And there are, certainly, among the People of the Scripture (Jews and Christians), those who believe in Allah and in that which has been revealed to you, and in that which has been revealed to them, humbling themselves before Allah. They do not sell the verses of Allah for a small price, for them is a reward with their Lord. Surely, Allah is swift in account.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And lo! of the People of the Scripture there are some who believe in Allah and that which is revealed unto you and that which was revealed unto them, humbling themselves before Allah. They purchase not a trifling gain at the price of the revelations of Allah. Verily their reward is with their Lord. Lo! Allah is swift to take account.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Indeed among the People of the Book there are some who have faith in Allah and in what has been sent down to you, and in what has been sent down to them. Humble toward Allah, they do not sell the signs of Allah for a paltry gain. They shall have their reward near their Lord; indeed Allah is swift at reckoning.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: There are some among the People of the Book who believe in Allah, and in what has been sent down to you, and what has been sent down to them, humble to Allah and do not buy with the verses of Allah a little price. Those, their wage shall be with their Lord. Allah is Swift at reckoning.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And indeed, among the People of the Scripture are those who believe in Allah and what was revealed to you and what was revealed to them, [being] humbly submissive to Allah. They do not exchange the verses of Allah for a small price. Those will have their reward with their Lord. Indeed, Allah is swift in account.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: There are some among the People of the Book who believe in God and what is revealed to you and to them. They are humble before God and do not trade God's revelations for a small price. They will receive their reward from their Lord. God's reckoning is swift.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: And most surely of the followers of the Book there are those who believe in Allah and (in) that which has been revealed to you and (in) that which has been revealed to them, being lowly before Allah; they do not take a small price for the communications of Allah; these it is that have their reward with their Lord; surely Allah is quick in reckoning.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wainna min ahli alkitabi laman yuminu biAllahi wama onzila ilaykum wama onzila ilayhim khashiAAeena lillahi la yashtaroona biayati Allahi thamanan qaleelan olaika lahum ajruhum AAinda rabbihim inna Allaha sareeAAu alhisabi

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Some of the People of the Book believe in God, and in what has been revealed to you and what was revealed to them. They humble themselves before God and do not sell God's revelations for a trifling price. These shall be rewarded by their Lord: God is swift in reckoning!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And there are, certainly, among the People of the Book, those who believe in Allah, in the revelation to you, and in the revelation to them, bowing in humility to Allah: They will not sell the Signs of Allah for a miserable gain! For them is a reward with their Lord, and Allah is swift in account.

verses.text: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ‌ آمَنُوا اصْبِرُوا وَ صَابِرُوا وَ رَابِطُوا وَ اتَّقُوا اللَّهَ‌ لَعَلَّکُمْ‌ تُفْلِحُونَ‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: ای اهل ایمان! [در برابر حوادث] شکیبایی کنید، و دیگران را هم به شکیبایی وادارید، و با یکدیگر [چه در حال آسایش چه در بلا و گرفتاری] پیوند و ارتباط برقرار کنید و از خدا پروا نمایید تا رستگار شوید.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اى كسانى كه ايمان آورده‌ايد، شكيبا باشيد و ديگران را به شكيبايى فراخوانيد و در جنگها پايدارى كنيد و از خدا بترسيد، باشد كه رستگار شويد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: اى كسانى كه ايمان آورده‌ايد! صبورى كنيد و استقامت ورزيد و از مرزها مراقبت نماييد و از خدا پروا كنيد، باشد كه رستگار شويد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: اى كسانى كه ايمان آورده‌ايد، صبر كنيد و ايستادگى ورزيد و مرزها را نگهبانى كنيد و از خدا پروا نماييد، اميد است كه رستگار شويد.

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: ای اهل ایمان، (در کار دین) صبور باشید و یکدیگر را به صبر و مقاومت سفارش کنید و مهیّا و مراقب کار دشمن بوده و خداترس باشید، باشد که فیروز و رستگار گردید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: ای کسانی که ایمان آورده‌اید! (در برابر شدائد و ناملایمات) شکیبایی ورزید و (در مقابل دشمنان) استقامت و پایداری کنید و (از مرزهای مملکت خویش) مراقبت به عمل آورید و از (خشم) خدا بپرهیزید، تا این که رستگار شوید. [[«صَابِرُوا»: بر دیگران در صبرکردن پیروز شوید و از آنان شکیباتر باشید. «رَابِطُوا»: مرزداری کنید و از سرزمین اسلامی خود مراقبت به عمل آورید.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: ای مؤمنان شکیبایی و پایداری ورزید و آماده جهاد [و سایر عبادات‌] باشید، و از خداوند پروا کنید، باشد که رستگار شوید

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: ای کسانی که ایمان آورده‌اید! (در برابر مشکلات و هوسها،) استقامت کنید! و در برابر دشمنان (نیز)، پایدار باشید و از مرزهای خود، مراقبت کنید و از خدا بپرهیزید، شاید رستگار شوید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: ای آنان که ایمان آوردید بردبار باشید و شکیبائی ورزید و خویش را آماده جنگ نگه دارید و بترسید خدا را شاید رستگار شوید

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: اى كسانى كه ايمان آورده‌ايد، شكيبايى كنيد و [در برابر دشمن‌] با هم پايدارى ورزيد و آماده كارزار با دشمنان باشيد- يا: مرزبانى كنيد- و از خدا پروا كنيد شايد رستگار شويد.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: هان ای کسانی که ایمان آورد‌ید! صبر کنید، و (هم) در صبر هماهنگی نمایید، و با یکدیگر رابطه و پیوند داشته باشید، و مرزها را نگهبانی نمایید، و از خدا پروا نمایید. شاید (خود و دیگران را) رستگار کنید.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: So you who believe, have endurance in suffering, be patient and persevere, strengthen each other and be firm, and be pious and fear God that you may find success.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: O People who Believe! Endure and surpass your enemies in endurance, and guard the frontiers of the Islamic nation; and keep fearing Allah, hoping that you may succeed.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: O believers, be patient, and vie you in patience; be steadfast; fear God; haply so you will prosper.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: O Ye who believe! persevere, and excel in perseverance and be ever ready, and fear Allah that haply ye may thrive.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: O you who believe! Endure and be more patient (than your enemy), and guard your territory by stationing army units permanently at the places from where the enemy can attack you, and fear Allah, so that you may be successful.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: O you who believe! Be patient, and advocate patience, and be united, and revere God, so that you may thrive.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Believers, be steadfast, and vie in steadfastness, stand firm in your faith, and hold Allah in fear that you may attain true success.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: O you who believe! Endure and be more patient, and Rabitu, and have Taqwa of Allah, so that you may be successful.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: O ye who believe! Endure, outdo all others in endurance, be ready, and observe your duty to Allah, in order that ye may succeed.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: O you who have faith! Be patient, stand firm, and close [your] ranks, and be wary of Allah so that you may be felicitous.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Believers, be patient, and race in patience, be steadfast, fear Allah, in order that you will be victorious.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: O you who have believed, persevere and endure and remain stationed and fear Allah that you may be successful.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Believers, have patience, help each other with patience, establish good relations with one another, and have fear of God so that you may have everlasting happiness.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: O you who believe! be patient and excel in patience and remain steadfast, and be careful of (your duty to) Allah, that you may be successful.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ya ayyuha allatheena amanoo isbiroo wasabiroo warabitoo waittaqoo Allaha laAAallakum tuflihoona

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Believers, endure, vie with each other in endurance, stand firm in your faith and fear God, so that you may succeed.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: O ye who believe! Persevere in patience and constancy; vie in such perseverance; strengthen each other; and fear Allah; that ye may prosper.
